definition[0]: to help someone by taking something from them, especially a job they do not want to do or something heavy that they are carrying
example[0]: A secretary was hired to relieve her of some of the administrative work.
example[1]: He rose and relieved her of her bags.
definition[1]: to take away someone’s job because they have done something wrong
example[2]: After the defeat General Meyer was relieved of his command.
definition[2]: to steal something from someone – used humorously
example[3]: A couple of guys relieved him of his wallet.
definition[3]: to help someone by taking from them something that they find difficult or unpleasant
example[4]: The transaction will relieve the company of $19.4 million in debt.
definition[4]: to take away someone’s job because they have done it badly or done something wrong
example[5]: The film company has suspended production of the movie and relieved the director of his job.
